qas.question: What was the literacy rate of Rajasthan in 1991?
How many females had the ability to read in Rajasthan in 1991?
What was the rise in female literacy between 1991 and 2001 in Rajasthan?
What is the national average for literacy in India?
What was the literacy rate of Rajasthan in 2001?
What did the literacy rate in India increase to in 1991?
In the 1991 census what was the female literacy rate?
How far below the average is literacy for women in India in 2001
What was the literacy rate for men at the 1991 census?

plausible_answers.text: praised for its efforts and achievements

qas.question: How has the state been recognized for its census effort?

context: In recent decades, the literacy rate of Rajasthan has increased significantly. In 1991, the state's literacy rate was only <a0_0>38.55%<a0_0/> (<b8_0>54.99%<b8_0/> male and <a1_0><b6_0>20.44%<b6_0/><a1_0/> female). In 2001, the literacy rate increased to <a4_0><b5_0>60.41%<b5_0/><a4_0/> (75.70% male and 43.85% female). This was the highest leap in the percentage of literacy recorded in India (the rise in female literacy being <a2_0>23%<a2_0/>). At the Census 2011, Rajasthan had a literacy rate of 67.06% (80.51% male and 52.66% female). Although Rajasthan's literacy rate is below the national average of <a3_0><b7_0>74.04%<b7_0/><a3_0/> and although its female literacy rate is the lowest in the country, the state has been <b9_0>praised for its efforts and achievements<b9_0/> in raising male and female literacy rates.
